info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 3:47PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL TRANSYLVANIA... SOUTHEASTERN HENDERSON AND SOUTHWESTERN POLK COUNTIES THROUGH 415 PM EDT... At 347 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Hendersonville, or 4 miles east of Dupont State Forest, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Flat Rock, Saluda, Dupont State Forest, Tuxedo, Crab Creek, Little River In Transylvania County, and East Flat Rock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
